p: Root endophytic nitrogen-fixing bacteria differed in their effects on the growth performance of A. adenophora seedlings ( Fig. 5). The average shoot length of A. adenophora seedlings treated with Duganella sp. (OTU02; XS01) was lower than that of the control group, all others revealed positive effects on various plant growth metrics. The WS05 isolate ( Rhizobium sp.) was the best growth-promoting isolate of A. adenophora among these six reNFB, which greatly increased the length of shoots ( P < 0.001) and roots ( P < 0.001) and had an evident positive effect on shoot biomass ( P wet < 0.001; P dry < 0.001) and root biomass ( P wet = 0.004; P dry = 0.005). Compared to the shoots, the six selected isolates showed a stronger positive effect on the roots of seedlings, and the wet- and dry-biomass RI of roots were significantly higher than that of shoots ( Fig. 6).
